thread.title: Maori King endorses Waikato-Tainui chairman to political battle
thread.title_full: Maori King endorses Waikato-Tainui chairman to political battle

author: ELTON RIKIHANA SMALLMAN
title: Maori King endorses Waikato-Tainui chairman to political battle
text:
Maori King endorses Waikato-Tainui chairman to political battle ELTON RIKIHANA SMALLMAN Last updated 16:57, March 9 2017 SUPPLIED 
King Tuheitia arrives at Parawera Marae where he endorsed Rahui Papa as a candidate in the Hauraki-Waikato electorate. 
​The Maori King Tuheitia has endorsed tribal leader Rahui Papa to run against Hauraki-Waikato stalwart Nanaia Mahuta, saying she had no mana in the Labour Party. 
According to 1 News, Tuheitia broke with tradition to give a strongly worded speech at a Poukai meeting Parawera Marae near Kihikihi, 40 kilometres south of Hamilton. 
He usually speaks at the annual celebrations of his coronation. fairfax 
Labour's Nanaia Mahuta 
Tuheitia, who received a kidney transplant in November, said Mahuta had been in parliament for more than 20 years "and now strong, intelligent leadership was needed" and his backing of Papa was due to the treatment Rino Tirikatene and Peeni Henare received from Labour leader Andrew Little. 
​READ MORE: 
Newshub reported Tuheitia as saying: "She's going right back to the backbench now. To me, she's got no mana in there now" in reference to Mahuta's slide down the Labour ranks. REBEKAH PARSONS-KING/FAIRFAX NZ 
Rahui Papa has been endorsed by Kingi Tuheitia to stand in the Hauraki-Waikato electorate. 
Mahuta, Morgan and Papa could not be reached by phone. 
After the king pledged his allegiance to the Maori Party at last year's Koroneihana celebrations in Ngaruawahia, speculation was rife Papa would stand for the Maori Party but Maori Party president Tukoroirangi Morgan refused to confirm the rumours. 
Morgan was set to announce his party candidates at a Poukai at Waahi Pa, Huntly in October but did not. FAIRFAX NZ 
Maori Party president Tukoroirangi Morgan. 
A deal was also struck with Mana Party to stay out of the battle for the Te Tai Tokerau electorate, leaving a clear run for Hone Harawira. 
Papa is the chairman of the Waikato Tainui tribal executive. - Stuff
